ai.summary: A mid-length lakeside circuit in the UK featuring mossy wetlands, woodland paths and lakeside views around Nelly's Moss Lakes. The 6.9 km route offers a moderate challenge with varied surfaces, including boardwalks and occasional wet sections.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-defined trails through woodland and open wetland. Surfaces include compact gravel, dirt, and muddy patches, with several wooden boardwalks over marshy areas. Elevation is gentle with a few moderate ascents and uneven footing.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast before you go; UK weather can change quickly. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and bring a waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths, be cautious on mud and boardwalks when wet, and keep an eye out for boggy sections. Bring a map or GPS, sufficient water, and a small first-aid kit. If hiking with others, share your plan and have a means of communication; respect local access rules and wildlife.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing with a waterproof outer layer
Map, GPS, or smartphone with offline maps
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn; Year-round with caution in winter.
